3GQ3r7OaKAdVUhY-mLMeWA.text: Went here for my birthday. The view was good, the portions were more than adequate but was not very inspired food. I went to a Dim T in Kensington a few years before and was impressed.

f_v8-54WVniG9mN8UHR7Rg.text: Dim T is right on the Thames and not a bad place to eat. They've got a good offering, decent wine and a somewhat cozy atmosphere. I went with a group of people and we shared lots of things, all were good. When the weather is nice they've got a great patio in front that is usually quite lively. It was a good experience so I'd have to say Dim T is OK by me, y'all!

GcdjvqdYjd98U1qPepr0pA.text: A modern European interpretation of a dim sum restaurant, in a great location.  The food is fine, it's reasonably priced and it's surprisingly child friendly, supplying crayons and colouring books for kiddies.  They have a range of set menus in addition to the a la carte selection and have funky little wooden tongs for dumplings grabbing for those that haven't mastered chopsticks.  For the area, this is quite reasonably priced and I haven't written off a revisit.  Are this chain and Ping Pong related ?

zcQcYxug0V8NMWkGKAaR_w.text: Brought my wife and two year old out for dinner after work on a suggestion from a friend. Had a great meal with an amazing view of Tower Bridge and served by charming staff who went out of their way to make our little guy feel welcome.

Pnkuw4qMFAvO3kapcaRHrg.text: A Fantastic experience at Dim T with food that was full of flavour and combined service that was really outstanding. We were a group of four and ordered a selection of starter dishes, the prawn crackers, spring rolls and edemames in spicy chilli oil were full of an authentic approach. The mains again a selection of really aromatic dishes, including the Chicken Firecracker which they kindly arranged with halal chicken and the cod and steamed rice which was cooked with richness. I should also mention the range of exotic lemonade options and fine served deserts. Above all was the truly friendly and exceptional service, which they managed and maintained even though the restaurant was busy with queues forming to the door. I would strongly recommend this place for a satisfying meal with brilliant service, which can be very difficult to reach in central London

qATvFBEN4Rp_rtVrXwnYEg.text: This branch of the dim t chain is all about the view of Tower Bridge. The restaurant was packed, but the service was quick. I tasted my first sample of Dim Sum, and, based on this experience, I would recommend it to anyone. The pork buns, mixed veg, beef and chive, spicy cod and cashew and chicken were all equally fabulous.The portions are not excessive, but filling, although my lemon chicken could have done with a tad more lemon in flavour.Drawbacks? It is very dark in the restaurant. I presume this is to enhance the view but, for me, it was a little off-putting.All in all, tasty, enjoyable and moreish.

mSKYmAD0zVk-AO2MkgYBng.text: An awful, awful, AWFUL Chinese "fusion" restaurant where every member of staff treats you like utter dirt. We spent 1 hour just waiting for badly cooked, overpriced "chinese" food. The manager's poor excuse for the terrible service was that one of our waiters was "new" (clearly new to human interaction in general too) and the other waiter, a speccy hipster guy who looked at us like we were scum, was leaving in a few days. I don't care if its his first day or his final day he's working at a supposedly good restaurant he should put in effort! Never set foot inside this disgusting "restaurant" (does it deserve this title?)

LLFFd1_t_f9LS3pZrT25JA.text: It's a shame that this review isn't going to be great for Dim T as I REALLY like it here and wish so much for it sort out the negatives so I wasn't left feeling disappointed each time and like I should have known better. How many chances to you give somewhere that you want to enjoy but who can't just quite pull it together? I've been here three times now and there are several things you really can't fault: 1. The view (especially from upstairs). It's surely got to be the best, unobscured view of Tower Bridge you can get. Simply stunning at night. 2. The layout and decor. So warming and cosy, with a quirky layout including a mixture of cushioned booths, circular & square tables and a waiting area. The dark wood looks very luxurious and the whole scheme is very well put together. Now on to the hit & miss parts.... The service really isn't the best and unfortunately it tends to sit somewhere between medicore, rude and lazy. Sometimes you are left waiting for things you've requested. Other times you get obnoxious comments when you ask questions about the menu (we ordered a bottle of the Shiraz and when it arrived it was a Merlot, only when we questioned this were we were told "we were out of Shiraz"). The prices are quite good and there are often offers available if you check online in advance. The food is tasty but I've found that the portion sizes aren't consistent. My udon noodle dish was half the size of the person on the table next to me. The food-intolerance menu is very frustrating, I noticed several errors and it was annoyingly laid out by what's not suitable rather than giving a list in the positive. I wouldn't say "don't go", but I'll keep my fingers crossed it's a night they're on good form and really urge Dim T @ More London to up their game as you've got the potential to be great!

Qox18B5Ul9TbRKFrQrMMQQ.text: An extra star for the location.  The food was the blandest I've ever had.  Just not very good.  However, it was not very good for a very decent price.

F9oKfn1DxLd876vryL1owQ.text: Pleasant enough food, great location and views, all a bit too corporate inside but that suits all the local suits

bSN5uMEgsG45vY3plimzbQ.text: Wonderful views of Tower Bridge especially from the upstairs part of the restaurant at night, but the food is only average in my opinion. The pad thai is unlike any I have tasted before (a bit tomatoey), and although it's great that the main dishes come with rice included in the price unlike some restaurants, the quality is not that great. I found the Hong Kong sweet and sour chicken sauce slightly gloopy and the firecracker prawns special was hardly anything special at all. Service was incredibly slow and you felt forgotton about particularly if you were a small group in the corner. The only redeeming parts of the meal was the duck spring rolls (starter), white chocolate cheesecake dessert, and the various teas on offer which were also good (particularly as they offered free refills of hot water). Would't go there again to be honest, unless I had relatives from overseas who were more concerned about the atmosphere and scenery rather than the food.

LsM5EHGC7CW1EhPocuNICw.text: This is a truly great place to go. It has amazing views of Tower Bridge, I will most definitely be recommending all my friends to this place and I am sure they will love it (almost) as much as I do. The staff are friendly and very attentive, i will be back in the very near future

SqAFrxiXfBaVWcp7c72d5A.text: I love dim sum, it's official! The curious thing is though that I'm very careful to pace myself with these restaurants. I go to this one here and the one on Charlotte Street and the food is d-vine.I just love the flavours, especially of the chiken and prawn dishes, but hey that's just me. They also do veggie stuff, which I can't vouch for because I tease my veggie mate Jemma terribly about how bland hers always looks! I won't even taste it because I like to save myself for the invariable surf n' turf medley heading my way! The service is always great, every thing is very tempting and don't they just know it! Take anyone you want here for any occasion and you will not be disappointed.

aFT0Wcw-0TG7dkxMObhDYg.text: Dim T is a pleasant place to enjoy a morning coffee, meal or evening drinks. The music is not too obtrusive to make it hard to hear your companion, the service is efficient and friendly, and the decor is modern and comfortable. There are a few tables outside. The drinks list is interesting, and this is an excellent place for a fan of properly served saki.

BVeazsLZ1EI2Vp9_EJqpwQ.text: This Dim T restaurant is right next to the river with amazing views of Tower Bridge - ask for a table by the window when you book! The food is also very good - perfectly cooked Dim Sum and not too expensive.

Ynads3st7DVYXxegSYDmCQ.text: The food is OK, my teenage niece and nephew love it. It's not a bad place to meet friends. Some of the desserts look very strange but there is one reason alone to go here - the view of Tower bridge at night is extraordinarily impressive. The best view of it I have seen. If you are out to impress but have limited funds this place - upstairs - delivers real wow factor. Go and see for yourself, even if it's not on the Michelin list, you will not regret it!

S2vGwY14MNrJ8c2pqXPaqw.text: The food is great, and the view and setting are lovely. The staff however, despite being friendly, are totally hopeless. They kept forgetting things, putting their elbows or hands in our faces or on our food, and the cappuccino was unlike any i've ever seen before.

SVLBBP_buGBXu8NtaBuoyw.text: Really quite poor... We were a group of 4. We ordered dim sum for starters, and then were told a fire in the kitchens meant either a 30 minute wait for dim sum or we could eat some warm bits from a trolley, but they didn't have vegetable ones there, just meat. Not great for a group with a vegetarian. OK, a one off perhaps. Then our main courses came and the waiter realised we didn't have chopsticks. He said he'd get us some, and then went to take another table's drinks order leaving us with our food getting cold until I went up to the counter to ask for chopsticks. The food, when we did get to eat it, was a very mixed temperature throughout the dish, cold bits of chicken thrown in with warm Japanese rice. Not good. On to dessert, then. The orders were taken before they came back to tell us one of the dishes was now off the menu, and again the food was disappointing. I paid nearly £5 for a pile of frozen berries with a tablespoon of melted white chocolate - nothing like the Ivy dessert it's stolen from. To sum up, next time I'll go to Ping Pong.

OsCM5WP0TCkGwpoJwhlA5g.text: I love this dim t. Amazing views, good value food (though we always stick with the dim sum) and wine with the Aresti gerwustraimeiner (sp?) particularly good with spicy dishes. Would be great for a cheapish date!

1_iuvsh_X3BJeSMa6UDQzQ.text: Fantastic location. Double Check.Beautiful interior. Check.Good service. Check.Good food.  Check.The views of the Tower Bridge at night from Dim T are simply stunning.  There is just no way to do them justice, if you are in the area you just need to go see for yourself.  The decor is dark and modern, but not uncomfortable, and the atmosphere was quiet and reserved, but not overly fancy or pretentious, and the service was fine.  My Thai Green Curry was quite nice; light and flavorful, but not overwhelmingly rich (and with a reasonable portion size, not Applebees-size for a change).  The Special Szechuan Rice was also very good; it was very flavorful, but don't be scared off by the 'szechuan' in the name, it's not terribly spicy!

cAI34iIAxYlmJ1xhjpsfPw.text: I previously had a very bad visit to this dim t (gloopy pad thai being the main offender) but I went back on Sunday and I'm pleased to say things were considerably improved!For a starter friends and I shared the sesame prawn toast, chicken gyoza and prawn crackers. These were all very tasty, well presented and great to share.For my main I had the curry udon noodles with prawns. The prawns were beautiful and the red curry sauce was delicious. Huge portion too. To top it off my lychee iced tea was packed with lychee flavour and so refreshing on the hot day!Really loved the food this time (perhaps better menu choices but everything was fresh and authentic). Unfortunately the service let it down by one star, I pretty much had to tackle a waiter to get his attention to ask for the bill!

fDs-C4dg4YTI8xhcl47xqw.text: Perfect location but was not happy with my food. Veggie options apart from starters were not interesting at all. Something they should work on

a_nNgZ2uYBwaq9cPyB3iIg.text: Good food, reasonable prices and an incredible view. Make sure to sit upstairs by the window if you go!

JyqbT5VBT5WT9Mpgxl4zkQ.text: Good food and a beautiful view of the London Bridge.  The view on the second level is even better but it was not open when we went- possibly because it was a Monday.  Overall, good food.  The raspberry ginger drink is delish too!

xxqOASnRtJ7087uLkh_a7g.text: I went to the Dim T in Victoria years ago and really enjoyed it. I met a friend here for an after work meal and it was just as good. I had the ginger tea with honey, a generous serving of 3 chicken, cashew nuts and coriander steamed dim sum and a sweet coconut with tofu main dish. The main was not like the kind of thing I normally order - I usually stick with safe options or something recommended to me - but it was absolutely delicious and a new favourite. I really enjoyed the dim sum too. My friend had the clay pot chicken and said it was very good. The service was really good and I was full after the meal so decided not to have dessert. Our waiter filled up our teapots and we had a nice long chat. The best part? After eating so much, we spent £17 each with tip. About half as much as I expected!

jQ6nsxO2I0Uxj2rYB2vsWA.text: Hubby and I were lazy and debating on either Strada or Dim T and given we hadnt been here yet and I was getting the hunkering for an asian invasion, I decided to go with this place.  It was bizarre to me that at 8:30 on a Wednesday that this place was PACKED, but its all good.  We had a couple drinks while we waited...wine was ok but the selection could be better.  Hubs had the mandarin mojito which actuallly was pretty good. We were seated with an awesome view of Tower Bridge and once we figured out who our waitress was, it was all good. We ordered the spicy chicken dim sum (really good!) and edamame, both decent. I ordered the steamed salmon with miso and came with a "chinese" coleslaw, which I find super funny, but whatevs back to the review.  The salmon was a nice big isze and i really liked how the coleslaw complemented the dish.  I was not too hungry so kept it light without rice.My dining companion aka chinese food snob ordered the chicken clayot and jasmine rice.  He was not super pleased with it but I had a bite and it seemed pretty good.  That said, we needed a TON of hot sauce, which I might attribute to being brown and loving spice so keep that in mind if you do go that spice is lacking.All in all, a decent meal...not something for me to write home about but healthy options and an amazing view.

TyXYw_f99Pv9mpgF4j1HBw.text: First of all, the views are stunning. Tower Bridge in full splendour, we even saw it opening to let pass a few ships, which was great.The food was ok, big portions in the mains and the price is quite good quality related.Our only problem was the service. Three waitresses that came several times asking the same questions their colleagues have asked already, really slow service (we had to wait for the drinks and starters for a long time) and one of them was even looking at her watch pretending to say it was taking too long to decide. We were in the upper floor and three members of staff were not enough.

XW3jHBsq2QE5i70lEJe-Kg.text: Really good selection (almost too much to choose from) and great quality dim sum. Can pre book and would be wise to if you are going at lunch time as the offices easily fill both floors most days

q_Cvxs2W6f65eEFYKKKLng.text: This is a really hit or miss kind of place. When you hit, it's great . When you miss, it's pretty disappointing. The dim sum, anything with duck, and most of the fish on the menu are almost guaranteed. Stray from that list at your own risk. You may find a diamond or just a lump of coal.Working nearby, my coworkers and I went here constantly, and most of us only had 1 or 2 things we would ever order from the menu, and if someone ever strayed from their "regular" without the recommendation of a friend, they were usually left with a bowl of something they didn't want to finish eating. Make sure to make reservations if you're going during the week, and if it's during the day, dress nicely. Any time there is a dress-down day at work and people go there, the already-slow service takes 3 times as long. I once waited for 50 minutes just to GET my food (not counting waiting for the waitress to take the order, or bring us our bill, let alone eating). But I love those crispy duck pancakes, so I was back the next week, suited and booted, in and out in an hour.

HtbBwk_369glnHSmowD9ow.text: Amazing food and the view of Tower Bridge is amazing at night!  Service was great.  Would definitely go again!

pIk_aFufgL9Crqf1jYMtRA.text: It's interesting how many reviews complain bout the service. Good service is not something I would ever expect with a Chinese meal! Anyway...The location is great, although much closer to Tower Bridge than London Bridge. Direction wise, it's opposite city hall - so whatever way you come just walk along the Thames Path and you can't miss it.As for the food, we stuck to the dim sum and it was very nice although pretty slow coming out. The miso soup was nice as well. I intended to write more, but at the the end of the day it's pretty solid, pretty well priced dim sum that won't blow your socks off. I'd imagine you could get better/cheaper stuff in China town, but this place wins on simplicity and convenience

fyXsHlLhKYmDx5oVUEHBbA.text: The best part about this place is the beautiful view of Tower Bridge and City Hall. It's not packed, which is a nice thing because you can actually hear what your dinner date is saying. Service is so-so, they're not the most attentive people in the world, but the food is great and the view outstanding.

MscC8LGf1PG082ofRxnqAQ.text: I was lazy. I was walking around for dinner options. "Dim sum" sounded good. I ended up eating here. First,  Dim T is not a full dim sum restaurant. It's more like "yeah, we serve some dim sum dishes as apps, but other than that we're a regular asian influenced restaurant". It was a lackluster experience. I ordered a fish dish that was bland in taste. I had to layer on the hot sauce to get some time of heat or flavor into the dish. Either way, I wouldn't come back unless it was the only place open late in the evening... There's so many other options out there. Pass on this.

8sd0NDfURj8jdh1_XWFE8A.text: Dim T London Bridge has a lot going for it- delicious food and drinks, great service and THE VIEW! Number on go to place when friends are visiting London. Really nice now in the warmer weather with the outside seating. Last night's dinner was fantastic with all 5 of us delighted with our meals.

0BjOtGMTRdbfEwn7RKbUZA.text: I've visited this restaurant more than 5 times and have never had a bad experience. The service is excellent and the food is delicious with big portions. I'm a fan of dumplings so it always makes a great starter. The view is unbelievable right next to tower bridge; especially stunning at night. I recommend asking for a seat upstairs by the window for the best view, its worth waiting for. It's particularly lovely in summer as The Scoop have free shows on in the evenings. Planning my next trip!

sz-4fa_AKn4J6Fyajqp-BA.text: I'm a big fan of Dim T! tried the chicken salad and it was the biggest and most sasisfying salad I've ever had! amazing!!!!! miso soup was pretty plain but the salad was something else!!!!

fVUtNtndu2kI1Zp9eCo5ZQ.text: This restaurant is great for value for money. - Amazing,  AMAZING view. Sit by the window. Wait if you have to, but sit by it. It makes any romantic meal or date 100% more amazing.- The menu is diverse and has a good selection for vegetarians, too. You won't be worried over not finding anything.- Order some cocktails. They have an inspired list of varieties you should sample, if just to sip on something stronger.- The portions are generous.- The prices are GREAT. London isn't a cheap place to eat, but this place offers quite a bit for a small price. Take advantage of it. Eat here and enjoy the beautiful view and location.

egauO6MSIqI9FKzPHfJ2Xw.text: Great venue if you plan to spend no more than 20 pounds. Perfect location just by the river and you have the most spectacular view of Tower Bridge. Dim T offer a range of fine Asian cuisines and delicious dim sum cooked to perfection. Smooth atmosphere, ideal place if you planning to take someone out of a date or just like to spend quality time with friends and family.

SYUf2YGXwZp-eLj-cPcAdA.text: Wasn't impressed by this place at all!For starters me and my friend shared the roasted pork bun. I've never had a "bun" before and I wasn't really impressed. There was a measly amount of filling and the "bun" itself was just uncooked pastry really!For mains I had a variation of stir fry and noodles (what the menu is dominated with), the portion was small and had very little flavour. I had to cover in sauces to try and make it more appetising!The view is great, but not worth the food!

qeEyjh2_oPCslTiY4iafWw.text: Good service, with a nice view of the London Tower. Descent price good for kids.  We enjoyed the Dim sum.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim T - London, United Kingdom

J88yHdo-_myuK4DoXTsxCQ.text: Service: 3 out of 5Food: 2 our of 5Do yourself a favor and go to a real dim sum place.  Would I return?  No.

GDjoHce-tyopM4xy4TkZ-Q.text: Cool spot with a million dollar view of the Tower of London and Tower Bridge.  Wait staff was excellent, and the food was fantastic!  I'm definitely a meat-atarian, but I accidentally ordered a vegetarian dish: Veggie Curry.  I pouted for a bit, but decided to have a good attitude about my little mistake.  And all I have to say is that I do not regret my choice at all!  Not only was it very tasty, but it was also very filling!  Not to mention that I had a great time with a large group of people, this will be a very memorable experience for me for years to come!  Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Dim T - London, United Kingdom. Million dollar view of Tower Bridge and Tower of London!

DXo6lQh1V3Pr0OsuMFBlpw.text: Good Asian restaurant, especially for Dim Sum. I personally prefer Ping Pong, another chain restaurant, which offers similar dishes bit in a nicer setting, and with generally friendlier staff.In this place, I was slightly disappointed by the service and the atmosphere: we had to wait to be seated although we had a reservation, and people entering the restaurant after us got seated before us. We also did not get a table with a nice view, and people at the table next to us were quite loud!

kNAZiNOEbppBT8yOqZMjOw.text: Right next to City Hall, as well as an easy river walk  from tower Bridge. Grabbed a table upstairs for a better view of the river during a busy lunch hour. Since even though it's late APril - it was still freezing out I went for my go to dish of Tom yum soup. Soup was good - they have options to replace the noodles in it with veggies or different healthier grains that I liked. Overall, good soup and a good value -though lacking the mushrooms I associate with it.  Folks next to me went with the dim Sum - looked very good and they enjoyed it. Service was exceptionally good.Overall: great value and service, good food for when that Thai craving hits - and a casual but not too casual ambiance that's good for catch-ups, casual lunches with co-workers, as well as families.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim T - London, United Kingdom

Ehgzz8RgVaudu9Ku2N5NkQ.text: A slop shop. Just paid £30 for tasteless slop. Dim Sum was cold and congealed; fried rice was cold; superfood dish was a watery tasteless mess; green curry was passable merely because coconut milk is yum. It's focus is tourists (i.e. not repeat custom) so the quality is low low low. To be avoided.

Sf3Rym0jStyteDDD07G1LQ.text: I went here as part of a surprise birthday meal for my friend and sadly,  2 stars is all it's worth! My 2 stars are for the good bits: 1 - the view! Best view of London Bridge, ever! Great if you're hoping to impress a date... 2 -  my dish, Nori Goreng - this was a very good,  tasty portion. However.... Definitely minus 3 stars for lessons apparently yet to be learnt (years later,  if you read the other reviews!)... Service - it really is poor. I was part of a large group for a surprise birthday. Naturally when it's a surprise,  the birthday boy/girl arrive AFTER everyone else. You would expect to be at least offered drinks while you wait,  yet we were ignored for 20 mins before we managed to flag a waitress down to order a drink. The would-be manager kept threatening to split our table because the birthday girl was running late yet our drinks didn't arrive until half an hour after the birthday girl herself,  despite polite reminders to the apparent manager! You definitely don't feel like a valued customer! Heat! It is like a sauna upstairs! I see on previous reviews years ago that this has not changed! It needs to! Not the most comfortable way to enjoy a meal! Menu - in short,  this is really a general Asian food restaurant masquerading as a dim sum place. The dim sum is a little limited if that's what you're looking for. It's a shame really because the view alone makes for a great atmosphere. It's a good job I was with great company!

Jne8dTDJYYLMHoCgqY1xKA.text: This place gets a star only because of the great view. Apart from that, If I could give minus star I would.The dim sum is avoidable, with it ranging between less than average at best to poor at worst. I ordered a steamed seabass as the main course. I came out over steamed, and the portion was tiny. Some of my friends weren't too happy with their food either.The service was terrible. We had to ask for plates, cutleries and glass several times before they arrived. My ginger tea took nearly 30 minutes to come.I won't be coming back here again that's for sure.

PUElS_KrZ8ajZTm4t0ambg.text: What a disappointment.... Had been to other dim t  (charlotte street & pimlico) and only had good memories.... However, this time around just didn't hit the spot. Location is beautiful, great view of City Hall & Town bridge but that is all. The dim sums were surely the same you can find frozen in any supermarket & the laska was absolutely flavourless. Not sure how you can make coconut soup flavourless but they succeeded. Will not be back to any dim t.

KdWOUIuQSS9a8mSwil4tkw.text: Dim T is primarily a Thai restaurant that poses as a "dim sum" restaurant near the Tower of London. LOCATIONIt couldn't be any better. Just a few minutes walk from the Tower Bridge station, this restaurant sits on the edge of the river and has a marvelous view of the City Hall and the Tower Bridge. The scenery from inside the restaurant next to the window or outdoor on the patio is one of the best in London. ATMOSPHEREDo not be fooled. Dim T isn't what you would expect if you're looking for the traditional dim sum experience where they push around carts of small plates that you point at and tally up on your card. Instead, Dim T is primarily a thai restaurant that also serves some dim sum dumplings that you can order off the menu. Once you get over that little nuance, the décor is really clean and modern for a Thai restaurant. FOODWhenever I go to a Thai restaurant, I like to order green curry, so I that's what I got! Unfortunately, their curry doesn't come with rice (boo), so I ordered a side bowl of brown rice. The texture was a bit grainier and thicker than I what I'm used to, but the flavor was all there and was pretty good. My companions ordered the crispy beef which is think and hard pieces of beef that 's stir fried in a thai chili sauce with onions, bell peppers and carrots. The flavor was pretty good but the beef left something to be desired. The spicy shrimp dim sum looked pretty tasty and was a bit more like what I expected to see at a dim sum restaurant. SERVICEIt might just be a London thing, but some of the servers here also didn't speak very comprehensible English. I think they may have been from Eastern Europe and had a thick accent that made me resort to just pointing at the menu for what I wanted. OCCASIONI think Dim T is a nice, casual, not too fancy place to take friends for a nice view of the city. It wouldn't necessarily be the best date spot because the food is just okay.

enwS5pzxTp3Lls_eu-a60A.text: Two stars for the view and the Italian waitress who was pleasant  enough, (although please note - while it is apparently acceptable in other countries to clear plates as people finish and others are still eating, here in the UK it is not!) but that's about it. Had a selection of dim sum which were ok but main courses were flavourless and quite frankly a joke. My Pad Thai had zero flavour or sauce. Ditto the chicken Katsu, ditto the soup bowl. If you have to drown everything in soy and chilli sauce at the table then something's gone very wrong in the kitchen. Noodles were all clumped together as if they'd been pre-cooked. This place was a total fail. There are plenty of better choices nearby.

HurdKeF6r72Q129JGQ56HQ.text: If you get the right spot near a window upstairs you will have an amazing view if Tower Bridge (For non Londoners this is the fancy bridge they used to out peoples heads in after execution, the plain looking bridge on the other side of the restaurant that is not visible is London Bridge.  The restaurant is in a fancy plaza between them on the south side of the Thames River across the Tower of London, the old fort/prison).  The restaurant is modern high end looking.Thats where anything good really ends.  The menu is Asian fusion and interesting, but the food quality is barely average if not below.  We had two people ask for out orders after a waiter took out drink order so we were confused, they said it doesn't matter.  These were not dedicated servers, they seemed to be all over. One of out orders were late and not in the order we asked with soup first. Expectations are higher for Asian food having lived in LA and Chicago, backpacked in Asia and numerous trips to Asia for business and vacation, but honestly just average at best.Would I recommend eating here on vacation it a night out if I lived in London?  Maybe.  The view is great IF you sit upstairs near the window away from the pole.  The environment is great.  If focused in ambience yes.  But there are restaurants all over this area.  Side NoteUnfortunately while we ate this meal a 23 year old man fell to his death from a 10 story balcony of an office building.  We later found out Scotland Yard did not believe it was foul play but police and ambulances were all over.   We could not see the incident but people were stopped in their tracks watching and we saw them but didn't know why.  When we left we saw a body with a blanket over it.  Thoughts and prayers to his family and friends.

0ew8mfOykAcFIpmXM5Pj4A.text: I love Dim Sum. I love Dim T. I used to go to the Winchester one all the time when I was in Southampton and I hadn't realised it was a chain.I was very excited to find one here too!I've only ever eaten the dim sum here, but I love it! delightful little packages full of fresh flavours. I also had the Asian Coleslaw as well this time which was very fresh and little bit sour; fabulous to have something without lashings of mayonnaise!We went around 6pm as well, so there was a happy hour for the beers and cocktails. The cocktails were a little sweet for me, and they were very fruit based. They weren't bad, I just like a more nuanced cocktail.The view is exquisite as well, you get a perfect spread of Tower Bridge through the windows upstairs.The only thing that I'm surprised about this time was the service. It was shot. When we arrived at 6.15 for our reservation we were the first ones to be seated upstairs as they had only just opened it. Therefore, because we were the only people up there, I can't explain why it took so long to get served?! It just makes no sense. There were a tonne of waiting staff up there, they all *looked* busy but I'm not sure how because there was no one to wait on up there apart from us. They took their sweet time getting to us to take our order and even longer to bring it over. Then even longer still when we wanted to pay our bill.Such a shame as I rarely ever relegate a place to the three star slot, but them's the breaks, Dim T.

eazuAXomfHBemlCJU7kYog.text: The great advantage of this location is the beautiful view on Tower Bridge. For this reason I'm giving it an extra star. The food wasn't special but enjoyable. We shared some veggie dumplings which were ok. I then had the Superfood Stir-fry and my friend ordered the Sweet Coconut which I finished for her and liked a little better than my own dish.They also have a fine selection of Asian teas which they serve in cute pots.Go there for a chilled atmosphere, some good tea, and simple Asian fusion cuisine.

wfj1aW02esZ5hq3BWqMM5Q.text: Not really a fan of the menu as it hasn't got a variety. However food came out surprisingly fast and what I ordered tasted ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Dim T - London, United Kingdom. Tofu udon

Pmmyf_BlGNxr8ULE7VVh6g.text: Couldn't wait to eat at this location because we stayed at the Hilton. The location and the view is awesome but the service is horrific. Pop in on first night in town, and we couldn't get a seat because it was buzzing with conversation and the wait was 30 minutes, so we left. The next day we went over after anticipating the food all day and I was disappointed. The place was half occupied and the staff waited almost 10 minutes to seat us - hey we're acting as if we were standing there. Finally after being seated hey took our order and the food trickled out. I actually saw our waitress sitting outside smoking a cigarette and when she came back in she went straight into the kitchen and grabbed our food, I hope she washed her hands! Needless to say, I won't be back, my husband enjoyed the noodles but I think nits overrated...I'm disappointed in the poor service.

xTVntDaT178Ume_wuPk4SQ.text: waited over 30 min.  Talked to table beside us who were there before us and they waited a long time for starters and their food was cold and tasteless.  They also sent their drinks back - so we decided to leave and not waste any more time.

49NLI55oZ3EQttSTz89F9Q.text: Ive now been here a whopping four times, mainly because it's convenient and dammit the food is good but fk me the service makes me want to kill myself.I dunno why, but its always just as bad each time. Why, Dim T, why?!

R3TZvESnkLXO-EGbZ23gww.text: Food was excellent, service... horrible.  Unfortunately I don't have the server's name but she just couldn't be bothered to wait on us.  We had to flag her down for everything - drinks, entrees, dessert, check - and she seemed as though she had better things to do than to serve us.  The final straw was when we ordered dessert and seemed to wait forever for it to arrive.  Finally  (about 10 minutes later) she comes with the check and when we inquire about our dessert she says that she put in the order and the chef said the kitchen was closed (it was the end of the day) so no dessert.  However, the charge for dessert was on the check so she had to take the check back to remove the charge.  Pathetic!The food, once we finally received it, was excellent.

L_-g-ZEb8VKi6LnYjS8AwA.text: Not sure how this place gets so many low ratings below. I've decided not to read them because they might taint my opinion.First off: the view! Oh my god is it good, straight out over the river with an unbroken line of sight to both the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. You need to ask to sit upstairs if at all possible, even though it was closed when we arrived the staff helpfully let us wait with a cocktail until we could go up.I think the prices are reasonable for the location, it certainly is economically closer to  its neighbour Strada than the mortgage requiring Gaucho on the other side. Think about a fiver for dim sum and starters and about a tenner for a main.The food was tasty without blowing me away, I really enjoyed the spicy edamame and you can't go wrong with a steamed pork bun. Also the menu is varied enough to pull me back to try other things.The service was friendly and attentive and overall I don't really have a bad word to say, definitely will be coming back.
